span.a: Meal pickup information for families - April 24, 2020

span.p: At St. Anthony-New Brighton (SANB), we are committed to supporting our students and community. Over the past several weeks, we are aware that families might be experiencing financial hardship due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.

One of the biggest challenges during distance learning is to ensure that children are fed. Meals that would’ve been served at school are prepared by our Nutrition Services team and delivered to two sites. We will continue to provide free meals to children, ages 18 and under.

span.a: Important message from the Superintendent regarding distance learning - April 23, 2020

span.p: We want to thank you for your patience as we have worked through distance learning over the past several weeks during Gov. Walz’s stay-at-home order due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Per the Governor’s updated directive as of April, 23, 2020, distance learning is to resume through the end of the 2019-20 school year.

span.a: Wilshire Park Elementary School Desk Material Pick up Day is tomorrow, Thursday, April 16

span.p: Come pick up your children's desk items tomorrow, Thursday, April 16, during one of the following time frames:

ul.li: Make a sign (child name, grade, teacher).
Place the sign in your car window and we will bring out their belongings and place it into your trunk.
Drive to the door of your youngest child. (Door 16 for grades K, 2, 4) (Bus Loop for grades 1, 3, 5).

span.a: Message from the St. Anthony-New Brighton School Board - April 14, 2020

span.p: The St. Anthony-New Brighton (ISD 282) School Board would like to thank everyone involved in supporting our community and educating our students in a creative and unprecedented manner. You have all done so much to plan, prepare, and act during this unprecedented time It is with heartfelt appreciation and gratitude that we would like to thank:

span.a: Maya Kruger sixth-grade language arts teacher named one of 10 finalists for the 2020 Minnesota Teacher of the Year- April 7, 2020

span.p: Maya Kruger, sixth-grade language arts teacher at St. Anthony Middle School (SAMS) has been named one of 10 finalists for the 2020 Minnesota Teacher of the Year. There were a total of 135 candidates this year.

img.alt: image of chalkboard with message of we miss our students

span.p: We did it! Yesterday, we did something amazing— we transitioned more than 1800 students to a new distance learning format. I’m so proud of our staff for making this monumental move in just five-days time. And, I’m incredibly proud of our students and families for showing up and taking on the challenge. We got this!

span.a: Distance Learning at St. Anthony-New Brighton

img.alt: Distance Learning at St. Anthony-New Brighton

span.a: Message from Superintendent Dr. Renee Corneille - March 27, 2020

span.p: The St. Anthony-New Brighton Teacher Parade will begin around 2:30 p.m., on Friday, March 27. The following are links to route information (PDF):

span.a: Message to families in response to Gov. Walz announcement - March 25, 2020

span.p: Remaining connected to our families is important to us, especially in this ever-changing situation with the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Gov. Walz announced today at his daily COVID-19 press conference that he is initiating an Executive Order for Minnesotans to remain safe at home for two weeks, effective Friday, March 27, to Friday, April 10. The top priority of this directive is for the health and safety of all Minnesotans.

span.a: St. Anthony-New Brighton is providing meal delivery to all children ages 18 and under - delivery begins March 30, 2020

p.strong: Grab-and-go meal pick-up is still available at the four locations listed below, March 26-27:

span.em: It is the St. Anthony New Brighton School District’s policy to provide equal education opportunity for all students and to provide equal employment opportunity for all employees. The district does not discriminate in admission, treatment, employment or access to its programs or activities. In addition, the School District does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, marital status, parental status, status with regard to public assistance, disability, sexual orientation or age.
